business_news.markdown:
## ðŸ’¼ Business News - 2025-11-08

### Top Stories

1. [Trump orders DOJ to investigate meatpacking companies for 'illicit collusion' amid rising beef prices](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/trump-orders-doj-investigate-meatpacking-companies-illicit-collusion-amid-rising-beef-prices)

2. [LARRY KUDLOW: Happy affordability and happy Thanksgiving](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/larry-kudlow-happy-affordability-happy-thanksgiving)

3. [National Debt Tracker: American taxpayers (you) are now on the hook for $38,118,268,221,748.03 as of 11/7/25](https://www.foxbusiness.com/economy/us-national-debt-tracker)

4. [Starbucks apologizes after Bearista cup launch sparks chaos: 'Exceeded even our biggest expectations'](https://www.foxbusiness.com/retail/starbucks-apologizes-after-bearista-cup-launch-sparks-chaos-exceeded-even-our-biggest-expectations)

5. [Consumer sentiment slides to near-lowest level on record as government shutdown drags on](https://www.foxbusiness.com/economy/consumer-sentiment-slides-near-lowest-level-record-government-shutdown-drags)

6. [Delayed or canceled flight? These are the latest refund rules](https://www.foxbusiness.com/lifestyle/delayed-canceled-flight-latest-refund-rules)

7. [Airlines are 'going to lose millions of dollars' over government shutdown's impact on flights, Duffy says](https://www.foxbusiness.com/economy/airlines-going-lose-millions-dollars-over-government-shutdowns-impact-flights-duffy-says)

8. [US household debt hits a new record, NY Fed finds](https://www.foxbusiness.com/economy/us-household-debt-hits-new-record-ny-fed-finds)

9. [Bessent says new rare earth factory will cut costs, break Chinaâ€™s 'chokehold' on industry](https://www.foxbusiness.com/economy/bessent-says-new-rare-earth-factory-cut-costs-break-chinas-chokehold-industry)

10. [Major League Wrestling's Court Bauer dishes on exciting growth, importance of economically friendly events](https://www.foxbusiness.com/sports/major-league-wrestlings-court-bauer-dishes-exciting-growth-importance-economically-friendly-events)

### Summary

Amid concerns over rising beef prices, President Trump has directed the Department of Justice to investigate potential collusion among meatpacking companies, highlighting the administration's focus on agricultural market dynamics and consumer prices. Meanwhile, economic discussions fluctuate with Larry Kudlow painting a positive picture of affordability during Thanksgiving, contrasting sharply with a record-low consumer sentiment amid a prolonged government shutdown. Financial accountability and consumer expectations are also in the spotlight, as the national debt soars to over $38 trillion and Starbucks' latest product launch causes unexpected chaos, respectively, underscoring the complex interplay between economic policies, market reactions, and public sentiment.

tech_news.markdown:
## ðŸ’» Tech News - 2025-11-08

### Top Stories

1. [How Press Photos Were Transmitted Back in the 1970s (2015)](https://petapixel.com/2015/07/26/this-is-how-press-photos-were-transmitted-back-in-the-1970s/)

2. [I needed fast embedded storage. RocksDB wasn't it. So I built TidesDB](https://tidesdb.com/getting-started/what-is-tidesdb/)

3. [Running a 68060 CPU in Quadra 650](https://github.com/ZigZagJoe/Macintosh-Q650-68060)

4. [What is the sense behind ZFS's limits](https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/336961/what-is-the-sense-behind-zfss-limits)

5. [Older Adults Outnumber Children in 11 States](https://www.census.gov/newsroom/press-releases/2025/older-adults-outnumber-children.html)

6. [Midjourney Powers Web Stack on Bun with Five Engineers Serving Millions](https://twitter.com/_chenglou/status/1986583136369844608)

7. [Diving into Rama: A Clojure LSH Vector Search Experiment](https://shtanglitza.ai/public/blog/rama-lsh.html)

8. [RaptorX](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=45853106)

9. [What happens to your body after you drink a can of Coke](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health-fitness/diet/nutrition/what-cola-does-to-your-body/)

10. [Why I stopped proofreading and started to listen](https://refp.se/articles/I-stopped-proofreading-and-started-to-listen)

### Summary

1. The article explores the historical methods of transmitting press photos in the 1970s, highlighting the technological advancements and challenges of the era, such as the use of wirephoto and early digital transmission techniques.

2. Faced with the limitations of RocksDB for fast embedded storage, the author developed TidesDB, illustrating the journey of creating a more efficient database solution tailored to specific performance needs.

3. This piece discusses the technical endeavor of running a 68060 CPU within a Quadra 650, showcasing the complexities and innovative approaches to upgrading and utilizing older computer hardware for enhanced performance.

4. The article delves into the rationale and implications behind ZFS's design limits, offering insights into the filesystem's architecture and how its constraints affect storage strategies and data integrity.

5. Highlighting a demographic shift, the article points out that older adults now outnumber children in 11 U.S. states, reflecting broader societal changes and prompting discussions around aging populations and policy implications.
